Our approach to collaborative mental health care.

The Northwestern Medicine Collaborative Behavioral Health Program (CBHP) is made up of an expert team of clinicians that deliver efficient, strategic, patient-focused mental health care. The program has integrated mental health care into more than 70 primary care practices. Based off the Collaborative Care Model (CoCM), this program, along with the Accelerator, will revolutionize mental health care across the country.

Overview

Collaborative care improves access, efficiency and patient outcomes.

Simply put, the CoCM expands access to early intervention and effective treatment, allowing clinicians to serve as many as 8x the number of people they could serve individually. Plus, patients get the benefit of receiving care in the familiar environment of their primary care provider’s office.

Our Research

Mental health deserves a dedicated team.

The CoCM emphasizes a team-based approach, where the patient is the focus of 3 dedicated mental health experts. They work together seamlessly, providing the best possible care while measuring progress through a registry.

Patient
Primary Care Provider
Behavioral Health Care Manager
Psychiatric Consultant
Registry

The patient is at the center of the collaborative care team.

The primary care provider oversees all aspects of patients’ behavioral health care...

The behavioral health care manager supports patient tracking and communication.

Psychiatric consultants support primary care through case reviews and recommendations.

The registry tracks patient progress and outcomes across the care team.

Research shows that only 50% of patients referred  to specialty mental health care attend their first appointment. The Northwestern Medicine Collaborative Behavioral Health Program (CBHP) helps close this gap by integrating mental health services directly into primary care, allowing patients to receive timely, effective support from their primary care team.

At Northwestern Medicine, primary care providers are working together with behavioral health experts to effectively treat mental health concerns like mild to moderate anxiety and depression. Patients can contact their primary care provider to get the care they need through the CBHP.

If you require emergency medical or mental health attention, please call 911 to access your local emergency services.

Enrollment for existing NM patients

Do you have questions or concerns about your mental health? Contact your primary care provider to enroll in the Collaborative Behavioral Health Program today.

What to Expect

Need an NM primary care physician?

You must have a Northwestern Medical Group Primary Care Physician to enroll in the Collaborative Behavioral Health Program. We can help you find a physician at a location that’s convenient for you.

Find a Physician

“A pervasive misunderstanding of the nature of psychiatric illness—and the benefits of psychiatric treatment—has impaired our ability to achieve reintegration of care.”

This only continues to foster a misunderstanding of efficacy towards available treatment options. The way forward requires that we build a health system designed to enhance stigma-free identification of patients, and uses effective, integrated clinical partnerships to fully address morbidity and mortality from psychiatric illness.

– Lisa J. Rosenthal, MD, FALCP, DFAPA

Additional Resources

Learn more about the Accelerator

The Northwestern Medicine West Health Accelerator is an initiative to make mental health care more accessible by integrating it into primary care through a collaborative care model.
